comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: From the linked nli record: Note on back reading: On Saturday 3 huge casks of tobacco were thrown into the Liffey. Yeasterday (Sunday) a Military 3 ton lorry endeavoured to salve the casks on shore but sunk in the mud. After efforts to try and save the lorry a "Whippet Tank" was dispatched to the rescue. Here is a photo of the rescue: catalogue.nli.ie/Record/vtls000218257/Image?lookfor=http:...

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: This was taken somewhere near the slip (now gone) and the Coast Guard Station on Pigeon House Road. Above left cask is G.S&WR goods shed (Point Depot) In the photo [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] found, the stacks of the old corporation power station can be seen in distance. maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,719049,733954,7,9 maps.google.ie/maps?q=Pigeon+House+Road,+Ringsend&hl=...
